member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataWriter.Close
member.summary: Completes any needed operations on the metadata buffer and releases the specified object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The supplied has not been opened with a call to .
No metadata items have been written to the supplied .
No metadata commands have been written to the supplied .

member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataWriter.Open
member.param: A pointer to an object to be opened for writing.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Open has already been called on the supplied since the object was created or since the last call to Close.
The provided pointer is not valid.

member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataWriter.WriteNextItem
member.summary: Starts a new metadata item at the specified offset.
member.param: The frame offset of the item within the range specified with the frameCount parameter to .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The has not been opened for writing with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to Close.

The number of items written in the writing session is greater than the value supplied in the MaxMetadataItemCount field in the passed into .
The frameCount value is greater than the value of the frameCount parameter to and the overflow mode was set to SpatialAudioMetadataWriterOverflow_Fail.
The value of frameOffset is not greater than the value provided in the previous call to within the same writing session.

member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataWriter.WriteNextItemCommand
member.summary: Writes metadata commands and value data to the current item.
member.param: A command supported by the metadata format of the object. The call will fail if the command not defined by metadata format. Each command can only be written once per item.
A pointer to a buffer which stores data specific to the command as specified by the metadata format definition.
The size, in bytes, of the command data supplied in the valueBuffer parameter. The size must match command definition specified by the metadata format or the call will fail.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The has not been opened for writing with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to Close.
was not called after was called and before the call to WriteNextItemCommand.

summary.para:
Provides methods for storing spatial audio metadata items positioned within a range of corresponding audio frames. Each metadata item has a zero-based offset position within the specified frame. Each item can contain one or more commands specific to the metadata format ID provided in the when the was created.
This object does not allocate storage for the metadata it is provided, the caller is expected to manage the allocation of memory used to store the packed data. Multiple metadata items can be placed in the object. For each item, call followed by a call to .
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
